general: This window displays General help for creating records. After completing changes and updates to this page, click the Save button at the top right corner of the page.

title.general:
The title should be written in plain language and include sufficient detail to facilitate search and discovery.

Avoid using the same title as a related paper if it doesnâ€™t sufficiently describe the resource as a standalone object.
title.edit: Click the pencil icon and enter a human-readable name for this resource

authors.general: This section should list all authors or collaborators who's work falls under one of the 14 roles listed in the CRediT Contributor Roles Taxonomy. Please add affiliations and ORCIDs as available.
authors.add: Click the plus '+' sign to enter co-authors for this resource.
authors.edit: To 'edit' authors already listed, click the pencil icon and make changes.[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
authors.dragdrop: To change the order of authors listed, click on the arrow bar on the left of each name, drag it to the right place in the list, and release the mouse button to drop it in place.

contactPoint.general: Enter the name of the NIST contact who can answer customer questions about your this resource.
contactPoint.add: Click the plus '+' sign to enter a contact for this resource.[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
contactPoint.edit:
To 'edit' contact point already listed, click the pencil icon and make changes

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]

landingPage.general:
The Home Page is the users' entry point into a dataset. It provides contextual information and access to the data itself. Importantly, the DOI (digital object identifier) will point to this URL.

This Public Data Repository page can be your home page. If that is the case please leave this box blank. If you would like to use another page please enter the URL here.
landingPage.add:
Click the plus '+' sign to enter a Home Page URL for this resource.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
landingPage.edit:
To edit this field click on the pencil icon and make changes.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]

description.general: This field is for a human-readable description of your resource that will enable a user to quickly identify whether it is of interest. You may wish to use part of the abstract of a related publication. Avoid copying the entire abstract if the entirety is not relevant to this discrete resource.
description.edit:
Click the pencil icon to add the description of your resource. If using part of the abstract of a related publication, ensure the text is relevant to this discrete resource.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]

theme.general: You are in Research Topics section where you can select toics from the NIST Research Topics Vocabulary. Select one or more topics that your dataset falls under.
theme.add:
Click the plus '+' sign to select topics for this resource.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
theme.edit:
To edit this field click on the pencil icon and make changes.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]

keyword.general: Add keywords, or subject terms that help both technical and non-technical users to discover this resource. Separate the terms with commas. You may enter up to a maximum of 4,000 characters
keyword.add:
Click the pencil icon to add keywords. Separate the terms with commas.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
keyword.edit:
Click the pencil icon to enter additional keywords. Separate the terms with commas.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]

components.general: Here you can enter links to external websites that allow users to access data or other information that are part of this publication. An example of this is a GitHub repository. Each link requires a title, descriptions, and a URL. To upload and link files please use the 'Manage Files' button below.
components.add:
Click the plus '+' sign to enter additional relevant links

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guideance]
components.edit: Click the pencil icon to edit the title, and descriptions of each link. Each should be short and descriptive of the link itself.
components.dragdrop: To change the order of links listed, click on the arrow bar on the left of each link, drag it to the right place in the list, and release the mouse button to drop it in place.

references.general:
You are in References section where you can add references or citations related to this resource. You may wish to include links to multiple types of resources -- such as a related publication or a software package.

[Other Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
references.add:
Click the plus '+' sign to add the URI of a related resource.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
references.edit:
Click the pencil icon to make changes to existing references listed here.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
references.dragdrop:
To change the order of references listed, click on the arrow bar on the left of each reference, drag it to the right place in the list, and release the mouse button to drop it in place.

[Helpful examples, links to policy and guidance]
